Generation IV.Diamond: It loves round white things. It carries an egg-shaped rock in imitation of Chansey .
Generation IV.Pearl: It carries a round, egg-shaped rock in its belly pouch and gives the rock to its friends.
Generation IV.Platinum: It likes to carry around a small rock. It may wander around others' feet and cause them to stumble.
Generation IV.HeartGold: It carefully carries a round, white rock that it thinks is an egg. It's bothered by how curly its hair looks.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: It carefully carries a round, white rock that it thinks is an egg. It's bothered by how curly its hair looks.

Generation V.Black: It likes to carry around a small rock. It may wander around others' feet and cause them to stumble.
Generation V.White: It likes to carry around a small rock. It may wander around others' feet and cause them to stumble.
Generation V.Black 2: It likes to carry around a small rock. It may wander around others' feet and cause them to stumble.
Generation V.White 2: It likes to carry around a small rock. It may wander around others' feet and cause them to stumble.

Generation VI.X: It carries a round, egg-shaped rock in its belly pouch and gives the rock to its friends.
Generation VI.Y: It carefully carries a round, white rock that it thinks is an egg. It's bothered by how curly its hair looks.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: It carries a round, egg-shaped rock in its belly pouch and gives the rock to its friends.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: It carefully carries a round, white rock that it thinks is an egg. It's bothered by how curly its hair looks.

Generation VII.Sun: It carries a round white rock in its belly pouch. If it gets along well with someone, it will sometimes give that person the rock.
Generation VII.Moon: It's too small to lay eggs yet. As a surrogate, it searches out round white stones.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Usually it's a well-behaved Pokémon, but if you take its round rock away, it will cry and fuss and throw a big old tantrum.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: When it sees something round and white, Happiny puts it into the pouch on its stomach. It sometimes becomes overloaded and can't move.

Generation VIII.Sword: Mimicking Chansey, Happiny will place an egg-shaped stone in its belly pouch. Happiny will treasure this stone.
Generation VIII.Shield: Happiny's willing to lend its precious round stone to those it's friendly with, but if the stone isn't returned, Happiny will cry and throw a tantrum.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It loves round, white things. It carries an egg-shaped rock in imitation of Chansey.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It carries a round, egg-shaped rock in its belly pouch and gives the rock to its friends.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: In imitation of Chansey, it keeps a round stone tucked into its belly pouch and cherishes it dearly. It gets along well with children and will sometimes play house with them for fun.

Generation IX.Scarlet: It carries a round, white rock in its belly pouch. If it gets along well with someone, it will sometimes give that person the rock.
Generation IX.Violet: It carefully carries a round, white rock that it thinks is an egg. It's bothered by how curly its hair looks.

Generation IV.Pearl: Hatch Egg received from a Hiker in Hearthome City Trophy Garden

Generation IV.SoulSilver: Breed Chansey or Blissey holding a Luck Incense

Generation V.White 2: Hatch Egg received from a Pokémon Breeder in the gate at Nacrene City
